intro: Abies fansipanensis, commonly known as the Fan mountain fir, is a rare and endemic species native to the high altitudes of Vietnam. It is a coniferous evergreen tree characterized by its needle-like leaves and cone-bearing structure. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil, typically found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features include a slender trunk and a conical shape, typical of many fir species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.

This species is found in the cloud forests of the Hoang Lien Son range, which is part of the larger Indo-Burma biodiversity hotspot. It thrives in cool, moist climates with high humidity and well-drained soils. The plant is typically found at elevations between 2,000 and 3,500 meters above sea level. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
